meanings.definition: Second person singular present of shall.
meanings.sent1: You shalt listen to your parents.
meanings.sent2: She shalt arrive at the party on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks you shalt feed it now.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's words shalt guide you like a compass.
meanings.sent5: The promise you made shalt not be forgotten.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate a command or obligation.
meanings.sent2: He shalt complete the task before leaving.
meanings.sent3: The sign clearly says you shalt wear a helmet.
meanings.sent4: The law shalt be obeyed by all citizens.
meanings.sent5: Your duty shalt always come first.
